warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.
Swing arms forward and backward, opening up the chest. Perform 2 sets of 15 swings.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm. Adjust the seat so your armpits are comfortably resting on the top of the pad.
execution: 1. Grip the barbell or dumbbell with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
2. Start with your arms fully extended and elbows resting on the pad.
3. Curl the weight towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Use an incline bench set at a 45-degree angle. Sit back with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Start with your arms fully extended, palms facing forward.
2. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, usually around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows stationary to maximize biceps engagement. Avoid swinging the weights.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
execution: 1. Grip the cable handles with an underhand grip.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, arms fully extended.
3. Curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to complete 8-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Start with your arms fully extended, palms facing each other.
2. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, usually around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a steady pace and avoid using momentum to lift the weights.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Lean back slightly and pull the bar down to your upper chest.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 8-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handles with palms facing each other.
2. Lean back slightly and pull the handles down to your upper chest.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return the handles to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, usually around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms to maximize back engagement.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported.
2. Grip the handles or bar with a neutral grip.
3. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to complete 8-12 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet firmly planted on the footrests.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handle with a neutral grip.
2. Sit upright with your back straight and pull the handle towards your torso.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return the handle to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, usually around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Keep your chest against the pad to prevent using momentum and focus on engaging your back muscles.
